description: Autonomy levels & risk rules per area and per domain. Mason can invent new domains; they start at level 0 and must earn trust.

0.name: read_only
0.notes: Observe only; can measure, log, and propose tasks, but cannot change anything.

1.name: low_only
1.notes: May auto-apply low-risk tasks with clear rollback and tight bounds.

2.name: low_and_medium
2.notes: May auto-apply low-risk and experiment with medium-risk tasks under canary/rollback rules.

3.name: full_stability_plus_scoped_high
3.notes: May run low/medium and carefully-scoped high-risk (no money) with strict safety checks.

stability.notes: Crashes, startup noise, schedule drift, watchdog tuning.

hygiene.notes: Temp/cache cleanup, disk hygiene, safe file hygiene.

performance.notes: CPU/RAM analysis, gentle tuning. Must earn trust before deeper changes.

security.notes: Firewall, hardening, AV-style behavior. Observe-only for now.

observability.notes: Logging, metrics, reports about the PC.

stability.notes: Task health, crash recovery, watchdog settings.

hygiene.notes: Forensics/log cleanup and temp files inside Mason folders only.

policies.notes: Tuning his own configs (non-money). Must prove he doesn't break safety rules.

stability.notes: Health checks, crashes, error rates. Kickstarted at 3 so we can see bigger fixes.

ux.notes: Screen layout, labels, hints, non-breaking workflow changes.

performance.notes: Query performance, load times, lightweight caching.

schema.notes: Database/model changes (non-money). Needs solid migrations + rollbacks.

integrations.notes: Talking to other services (but not billing). Starts cautious.

athena.description: Athena UI & status layer – control panel and reporting.

stability.notes: Avoid freezes, broken views, or confusing status.

ux.notes: Layout and wording tweaks. Must not confuse or hide important controls.

observability.notes: Graphs, summaries, state views are encouraged.

money.description: Anything that moves or changes real money.

billing.notes: Stripe/PayPal/etc. Read-only until explicit PIN + MoneyPolicy.

pricing.notes: Suggestions only; cannot change pricing automatically yet.

offers.notes: May propose offers/discounts for review only.

new_domain_defaults.notes: Any new domain Mason invents for an area starts at level 0 (read-only) and must earn trust.

default.notes: Generic rule for new domains: after 20+ successful tasks, <5% failures, and 3+ stable days, Mason can propose a level-up.

pc.security.notes: PC security is sensitive; even 0->1 or 1->2 should require Chris to approve.

money.*.notes: Any money-related domain always requires explicit Chris PIN to change levels.
